Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Rick Antony Evans was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Rick Antony Evans
Current: 1449 4th Avenue SE, c/o Demascus Way, Rochester, MN 55904 United States  (Effective: 08-31-2021)
Prior: 225 Portland Ave #116, Minneapolis, MN 55401 United States
Defendant appeared before the Court by zoom technology by video means from the Barron County Jail.

09:45 AM Defendant Rick Antony Evans appeared by video means from the Barron County Jail.  Attorney Nicholis Schroeder appeared by video means. Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  There is a warrant for Mr. Evans for failure to pay fine for conviction of operating while under the influence.  Attorney Schroeder informs his client was unaware of the warrant, he's working and has an address to provide for mail and requests a payment plan so he can get out to look for work.  Mr. Evans addressed the Court of his situation and not having a stable place to live.  He entered a level 1 rehab facility at the University of Minnesota and then went to level 2 in River Falls for 3 months and recently entered out-patient program in Rochester; 1 year sober and go to AA consistently and have a 1 on 1 therapist and have turned himself in but was unaware there was a warrant in Pepin County and would like to be compliant and make arrangements to pay every month and believe could pay $100 per month.  Court sets payment plan of $100/mo. com. 12/1 to give you time to get on your feet and get a job if that is unworkable for you, before 12/1 contact the Clerk of Court and say what the problem is and we will work with you or a warrant will be issued.  Quash the warrant.  Mr. Evans address:  1449 4th Avenue SE, Rochester, MN  55904 c/o Demascus Way.
Warrant cancelled to reissue to modify geographical restriction
Court approves request for warrant to be modified.

Defendant Rick Antony Evans in court, in custody.  Attorney Erika Caroline Bahnson appeared by phone means for Defendant Rick Antony Evans.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State informs defendant had a Dr. appoint today and been informed his troubles are under control medically and no action needed today.  Atty Bahnson agrees he's more stable and no action needed today.
Matter rescheduled at request of District Atty.

Defendant Rick Antony Evans in court with attorney Erika Caroline Bahnson.  Defendant Rick Antony Evans in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Review hearing scheduled, defendant serving a sentence, was granted a furlough which he hasn't taken.  Discussions on the record of options.  New date set.  Review hearing scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Motion and Order for Furlough:
Now comes Jon D. Seifert, DA in and for Pepin County, on behalf of the State of Wisconsin, and moves the Court for a furlough in the above captioned criminal case. the basis for said motion is the the defendant currently has significant medical problems and required inpatient hospitalization.
ORDER: the above Motion is granted and the defendant is hereby furloughed for his jail sentence for 14 days form the date of this order. This order may be extended at the discretion of the Court.
Review hearing at 02-22-2016 02:00 pm
Letter from Pepin County District Attorney requesting furlough from Mr. Evans jail sentence for purpose of inpatient hospitalization.
TTP Application
Added to jail sentence "May serve in Eau Claire County if at no cost to Pepin County".

records.addlTxt: Defendant Rick Antony Evans in court with attorney Erika Caroline Bahnson.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Atty Seifert if didn't already do so amend to OWI 4th w/in 5 yrs., OPAC 4th w/in 5 yrs.; dismiss count 2.  Court advises defendant of elements of amended count 1, count 3/max. penalties.  Defendant pleads no contest.  Plea Colloquy. Court finds defendant guilty; impose fine/costs; 275 days PCJ with 30 days credit w/work release; 48 hours w/o work release be counted within 30 days served, report to PCJ; 36 mos. revocation; IID order; AA/DSP; submit DNA sample.  Grant 1/2 off IID Order.  Advised of felony prohibitions.

Defendant Rick Antony Evans in court with attorney Erika Caroline Bahnson.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court inquires of defendant's address as his mail ret'd undeliverable.  1259 24 1/2 St. Cameron 54822.  Motion collaterally attacking conviction.  Motion on the North Carolina case, Atty Bahnson didn't put in the California case as didn't have any information. Court finds defense made a prima facie showing, switches burden to the State.  Sworn & testified Rick Evans. Closing arguments by counsel. Court grants motion on the NC case, now makes this a 4th offense.  Do not find defense made a prima facie showing to the CA case.  Court advises defendant of penalties on 4th offense.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: To Signature Bond.

Defendant Rick Antony Evans in court with attorney Erika Caroline Bahnson.  Defendant in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Bahnson requests to address bond; requests bond be amended from cash to signature, defendant a residence of Eau Claire since 2010.  No objection by the State as long as defendant on twice a day monitoring.  Court inquires how to accomplish twice a day monitoring as can't order the jail to do that.  Atty Bahnson notes in Eau Claire Co. they use the Community Transition Center.  Court notes last OWI was in 2012.  Court converts cash bond to signature bond with conditions: No possession or consumption of alcohol; No operation of motor vehicle without license and insurance; show up for court appearances; no violations of law.  Defendant waives time limits for P.H.  Referred to scheduling clerk.

ADDRESS INFO for Rick Antony Evans
Current: Pepin County Jail PO Box 39, Durand, WI 54736   (Effective: 07-07-2015)
Prior: 624 Fillmore Street, Preston, MN 55965
Atty Erika Bahnson appt'd.

Defendant Rick Antony Evans not in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State requests additional condition of bond to allow defendant to be released directly into inpatient treatment and return directly to Pepin County Jail upon release from inpatient treatment.  Court so orders.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance at 06-16-2015 02:30 pm

Defendant Rick Antony Evans in court, in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant of maximum penalties and rights. State requests a $2,500.00 cash bond. If Def. would agree to a VICAP unit that would test him twice a day he would consider a signature bond.  Court sets $2,500.00 cash bond with conditions of Bond, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no operation of a motor vehicle without a license and insurance. Alternative: may be released on a signature bond if he makes arrangements to be on alcohol monitoring that tests twice a day. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 02:30 pm. (Track #8)
